bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, September 19, 1952

div1.p: Hench provides the correct spellings of Cooke and Hanberry. Cooke is in ill health and will not be able to travel to Cuba for the dedication of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, September 19, 1952
div1.opener:
September 19, 1952
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Marti 219, Marianao
Habana, Cuba
My dear Pedro:
div1.p:
I believe I told you that the Surgeon General informed me that Doctor
Cooke's complete name was Robert Powell Page Cooke. I told you I would
try to confirm this name which I had never seen before. Mrs. Cooke
writes me that Doctor Cooke dropped the “Powell” from his name years
ago and prefers to be known as Robert Page Cooke so that is the way it
should be on the memorial tablet. Unfortunately, his health is such
that he could not go to Cuba. As I wrote you, his address is
Whistle Creek, Lexington, Virginia. I know he would like to receive
an invitation even though he would be unable to attend.

Pedro, I am most anxious to know how you are coming along with your
plans. Is the Camp to be dedicated the end of this month? I would
greatly appreciate hearing from you.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:acc
P.S.: Mr. Hanberry confirms, in a letter received in my morning mail,
that his name is James Leonard Hanberry. He is anxious to hear more about
the dedication.
